title: Frank’s Place, Gender, and New Orleans: Using Folklore to Create Televisual Place
abstract: Research Article| December 01 2017 Frank’s Place, Gender, and New Orleans: Using Folklore to Create Televisual Place Robin Roberts Robin Roberts Robin Roberts, professor of English at the University of Arkansas, is the author of six books on gender and popular culture, including Ladies First: Women in Music Videos, Sexual Generations: Star Trek: The Next Generation and Gender, and Subversive Spirits: The Female Ghost in British and American Popular Culture. She is currently working on a book about the representation of New Orleans on television.
